oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Photomontage of photographs of paintings purchased by the Nashville Art Association and the City Art Commission. Nashville Banner, 1927 March 27.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: West, Benjamin; Bailey, J. E.; Campbell, Dorothy
Nashville Banner
Paintings; Portraits; Children; Landscapes (Representations); Nuns; Art; Executions
Nashville (Tenn.)--History--Sources; Nashville (Tenn.)--Social life and customs; Nashville and Davidson County (Tenn.)--History--Sources
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: Photomontage of photographs of paintings purchased by the Nashville Art Association and the City Art Commission. Paintings are mostly portraits, but also include a landscape, a still life, and a scene of nuns being executed by guillotine during the French Revolution. 16 x 21.5 in. Forms part of the Nashville Newspaper Rotogravure Digital Images Collection.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:creator: West, Benjamin; Genth, Lillian; Couse, E. Irving; Delaroche, Paul; Van der Banck, J.; Silva, William P.; Adams, Wayman; Kneller, Godfrey
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:publisher: Metropolitan Nashville/Davidson County Archives, Nashville Public Library
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:relation: Nashville Newspaper Rotogravure Digital Images Collection.
